subject: AI
title: Citing Sources
description: Make the model point to where it found the answer.

hook.text: The user asks about your pricing plan. The model says '$49/month.' Is that from your docs or hallucinated? Without citations, there's no way to verify.

buildup.text: Include chunk labels in the prompt: '[Source A: pricing.md] Our plans start at $49/month...' Then instruct the model: 'Cite sources by label (e.g., [Source A]) for each claim.'

discovery.text: Citations serve two purposes: users can verify the answer, and developers can audit which chunks the model actually used. Both build trust.

twist.text: Models sometimes cite the wrong source â€” attributing a claim to Source A when it came from Source B. Validate citations programmatically by checking if the cited source actually contains the claim.

climax.text: Link citations to the original document. Users click a citation and see the full source. This turns a chatbot answer into a verifiable reference.

punchline.text: If you can't point to where the answer came from, you can't trust it. Citations make RAG trustworthy.

quiz.question: Why should RAG systems include citations in their answers?
options: To let users verify claims and developers audit model behavior
Citations are only needed for academic papers
